channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump seeks to block release of special counsel report
item.description: Lawyers of the US president-elect oppose the release of findings from two abandoned criminal investigations.

item.title: The next round of bitter cold and snow will hit the southern US
item.description: The next round of bitter cold is set to envelop the southern U.S., after the first significant winter storm of the year blasted a huge swath of the co...

item.title: Jimmy Carter will be honored in Washington, a city where he remained an outsider
Biden meets exiled Venezuelan opposition candidate
item.description: US President Joe Biden calls Edmundo González "the true winner" of Venezuela's contested presidential election.

item.title: Controversial Trump picks like Sebastian Gorka likely to bypass Senate scrutiny
item.description: Sebastian Gorka failed security screenings during Trump's first term, but could return as White House counterterrorism chief.

item.title: 2 people found dead in JetBlue plane landing gear at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport
item.description: The bodies were found during a routine inspection after the plane landed.

item.title: Medical debt banned from credit reports by new Biden administration rule
item.description: Unpaid medical bills will no longer appear on credit reports under a final rule announced by the Biden administration.

item.title: 10 gunmen killed in shootout with police amid cartel turf battles
item.description: The early morning shootout happened during a joint patrol by police and the military in Guanajuato.

item.title: Indiana serial killer's victims could be identified amid new push
item.description: Investigators estimated at least 25 people were buried at Harold Baumeister's estate, based on evidence that included 10,000 bones and bone fragments.

item.title: What America's top economists are saying about AI and inequality
item.description: Planet Money attended the annual meeting of American economists — and the most popular topic this year was artificial intelligence.

item.title: French far-right politician Jean-Marie Le Pen dies at 96
item.description: Le Pen - an unrepentant extremist on race, gender and immigration - founded the far-right National Front in 1972.

item.title: Jimmy Carter's funeral services begin in Washington, D.C., today
item.description: The next stop in former President Jimmy Carter's six days of funeral services is Washington, D.C., where he will lie in state in the U.S. Capitol thro...

item.title: McDonald's says it is revising some of its diversity practices
item.description: McDonald's says it is changing some of its inclusion standards, becoming the latest large company to announce it is rolling back some of its diversity...

item.title: Trump’s praise of Carter in death after jeering him in life deepens a contradictory relationship
Tibet earthquake: Scores dead as tremor strikes holy city
item.description: At least 95 people are confirmed to have died in one of China's deadliest quakes in recent years.

item.title: Jean-Marie Le Pen, founder of French far right
item.description: A Holocaust denier and unrepentant extremist on race and immigration, the far-right politician has died at 96.

item.title: How to quickly find something you lost: 10 clever and practical techniques
item.description: NPR readers share their best methods for finding missing objects — from tiny screws to lost wallets. One favorite tip? Use a good flashlight.

item.title: Biden creates 2 new national monuments, setting a conservation record
item.description: The White House says President Biden has now protected a total of 674 million acres of lands and waters — a record for any administration. This includ...
